want.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to have a desire for something
want.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: What do you want for your birthday?
She’d always wanted to go to Thailand.
I don’t want Linda to  hear about this.
He didn’t want the holiday to end.
You can order whatever you want.
This shampoo is mild enough to use every day if you want.
If she doesn’t get what she wants, she’s not happy.
He wanted that job so badly he was willing to kill for it.
What I want to know is when we’re going to get paid.
All I want is the chance to prove myself.
Oh thank you, it’s just what I’ve always wanted.
want.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used to say that you need something or to ask someone firmly to do something for you
want.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Do you still want these magazines, or can I throw them out?
What do you want with a tool kit  (=what do you need it for)?
It always makes me want to sneeze.
make you want to cry/throw up etc
I want that letter typed today.
I want you to find out what they’re planning.
want.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: used when offering or suggesting something to someone
want.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Do you want me to come with you?
Who wants a cup of coffee  (=used to offer something to a group of people)?
want.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: used to say that something is sensible or that someone should do it, especially when giving advice
want.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: You might want to install anti-virus software.
I wouldn’t want to come here at night.
You want to see a doctor about that cough.
You don’t want to leave that – it’ll get wet.
want.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to ask for someone to come and talk to you, or to come to a particular place
want.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Christine wants you in her office now.
want.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: to suffer because you do not have something
want.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: In many poorer countries, people still want basic food and shelter.
want.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: if you want someone, you want to have sex with them
want.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: She very much wanted to do the right thing.
badly
How badly do you want to win?
desperately
He desperately wants his mum and dad to get back together.
really
Do you really want to succeed?
just
I just want to be left alone.
whatever/anything you want
Now he can do whatever he wants.
whenever you want
Joanna is happy for him to see his son whenever he wants.
wherever you want
You can park wherever you want.
if you want (to)
You can go if you want.
get what you want
You’ve got what you wanted, so you might as well leave.
do what you want
You can do what you want, instead of being told what to do.
what I want to do is ...
What I want to do is develop the skills I already have.
all I want is ...
All I want is a normal life.
it’s just what I’ve always wanted
Thanks for the bread machine – it’s just what I’ve always wanted.
want.translation[0].note_box[1].items[0]: Do you want some more coffee?
want.translation[0].note_box[1].items[1]: Do you want to have some more coffee?
want.translation[0].note_box[1].items[2]: You want someone to do something
They want their son to go to a good university
want.translation[0].note_box[1].items[3]: Want is not usually followed by a ‘that’ clause
They want that their son goes to a good university
want.translation[0].note_box[1].items[4]: You say I don’t want someone doing something, when this is annoying or causes problems
I don’t want other people telling me how to spend my money
I don’t want other people to tell me how to spend my money
want.translation[0].note_box[1].items[5]: Want is not usually used in the progressive You say
want.translation[0].note_box[1].items[6]: In spoken English, people sometimes say I’m wanting to describe their feelings about something that is happening right now or that they have just seen or heard about
Suddenly I’m wanting to know more about this man
want.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: something that you need but do not have
want.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: a disgraceful want of proper care
want.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a situation in which you do not have enough food, money, clothes etc
want.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: the chronic want and deprivation in the townships
